channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024021269
item.description:
Report X-2024021269

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR 70 IN THE UNLOAD WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND THE RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. BOX WAS WET. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024020445
item.description:
Report E-2024020445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: SCRANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 12, 2024, two (2) 35-pound cartons of UN3242 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lewis Environmental (LE) to remediate the impacted site. All powder was swept in with hand tools and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crews depalletized all affected product and placed them into five (5) 55-gallon drums. All drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021012
item.description:
Report X-2024021012

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: a trainer informed one the admin that there was a leaking hazmat on a trailer. Grabbed my PPE and the red hazardous waste bin to get the damaged hazmat. Brought it back to QA, began to inspect. There were 4 bottles in a black trash bag. DescribePack: One of the bottle liquid level was lower than the rest. The cap does not look like it was completely secured on the bottle and leaked out. DurationRel: 18 and MitigateEffect: Kept the box and the bottles upright to prevent any more leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024020692
item.description:
Report X-2024020692

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2 x 5 liters plastic bottle of Rapicide part A and 2 x 5 liters plastic bottle of Rapicide part B 1x 5 liters plastic bottle of Rapicide part B had a loose cap allowing .25 liters to release from bottle. package had slotted partitions and inner package no bags or adsorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 5 liters plastic bottle of Rapicide part A had a loose cap allowing .25 liter to release from bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote.

Report X-2024020665

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN UNLOAD LEAKING. QA WAS CONTACTED AND IDENTIFIED HAZMAT AND PLACED INTO YELLOW DRUM. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING ROUGHLY HALF OF THE LIQUID TO SPILL OUT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS QUICKLY SECURED INTO YELLOW DRUM AND LOG INTO CAGE

item.title: Report E-2024020447
item.description:
Report E-2024020447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: ALLENTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill occurred inside of the trailer in Allentown, PA. The spill consists of (1) 55 gallon metal drum of , Isopropyl alcohol (UN1219) which was found damaged with a loose lid and sloshed out of the drum during unloading, causing approximately 1 gallon to spill out onto the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who were comfortable cleaning the spill with Oil Dri and PPE on site, the used absorbents, PPE and product were placed into an 85 gallon metal drum for disposal on site for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024021095
item.description:
Report X-2024021095

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver brought the leaker to QA cage 1, stating that it was leaking and it could not be delivered. The package was immediately put into a lined spill bin while the SDS was pulled up. The SDS revealed it was a limited quantity and needed to be processed as a damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Box was soggy and the bottles had broken through the wet cardboard. One bottle had completely leaked and was tipped over. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box put into tote to prevent more leakage, lids were tightened

item.title: Report X-2024020603
item.description:
Report X-2024020603

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package presented in Unload, and had small amount of leakage on the outside of package. Given to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Inspection found a dent in the metal container lid where and estimated 2oz of liquid was released. The outter package had no indications of being damaged with the exception of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was contained to package. Package was taken to Hazmat cage.
